name: Enforce HTTPS for CloudSearch Domain Access
description: Ensure that all CloudSearch domains enforce the use of HTTPS (TLS) for all access. This should be configured in the domain's access policies to only allow secure connections.

name: Use Latest TLS Version for CloudSearch Domain Connections
description: Configure CloudSearch domains to use the latest supported TLS version for all client connections. This ensures the highest level of connection security and encryption strength.

name: Enable Encryption at Rest for CloudSearch Domain
description: Enable encryption at rest for all CloudSearch domains using AWS Key Management Service (KMS) Customer Managed Keys (CMKs). This ensures that all data indexed and stored in CloudSearch is encrypted when not in use.

name: Implement VPC for CloudSearch Domain
description: Configure CloudSearch domains to use VPC access, placing the domain's endpoints within a specified VPC. This provides network isolation and allows for more granular control over access to the domain.

name: Restrict CloudSearch Domain Access to Specific VPC Endpoints
description: When using VPC access for CloudSearch domains, restrict access to specific VPC endpoints or security groups. This ensures that only authorized resources within the VPC can access the CloudSearch domain.

name: Implement IAM Policies for CloudSearch Domain Access
description: Create and apply IAM policies that follow the principle of least privilege for accessing CloudSearch domains. These policies should grant only the necessary permissions to authorized entities for managing and using the CloudSearch domains.

name: Enable CloudSearch Domain Monitoring with CloudWatch
description: Configure CloudWatch to monitor CloudSearch domains, setting up alarms for critical metrics such as search latency, indexing latency, and successful requests. This helps in detecting and responding to performance issues or potential security incidents.

name: Implement Regular Backups for CloudSearch Domain Data
description: Establish a regular backup process for the data indexed in CloudSearch domains. This can be achieved by periodically exporting the domain's data to a secure S3 bucket, ensuring data recoverability in case of incidents.

name: Use Secure Configuration for CloudSearch Suggesters
description: When configuring suggesters for CloudSearch domains, ensure that sensitive data is not included in the suggestions. Review and sanitize data used for suggestions to prevent potential data leakage through autocomplete functionalities.

name: Implement Access Policies for CloudSearch Document and Search Endpoints
description: Create and apply access policies that restrict access to CloudSearch document and search endpoints. These policies should allow access only from authorized AWS accounts, IAM users, or IP ranges, ensuring that indexing and searching operations are performed only by trusted entities.
